metadata.title: CVE-2019-5827 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in SQLite via WebSQL in Google Chrome prior to 74.0.3729.131 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5827` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 74.0.3729.131-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 74.0.3729.131-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 74.0.3729.131-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 74.0.3729.131-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 74.0.3729.131-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

lemon - 3.27.2-3
libsqlite3-0 - 3.27.2-3
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.27.2-3
sqlite3 - 3.27.2-3
sqlite3-tools - 3.27.2-3
No subscription required

notes.note: mdeslaur> this is a chromium-specific flaw related to data types used in memory allocation. This isn't directly an issue in sqlite3 although the commits listed do prevent the issue from happening.

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '74.0.3729.131-0ubuntu1').
sqlite package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
sqlite3 package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.27.2-3').
